intro: Campanula rotundifolia f. borbasiana, commonly known as the Borbasian bellflower, is a compact, herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its rounded, broad leaves and clusters of bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils in partial to full shade. It is often found in woodland areas and along streambanks, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to naturalize in suitable environments.
